instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad
threads.message:
Got a Mac air of which the trackpad is frozen. Keyboard works. I changed the trackpad, same result. Measuring pin 10 of the trackpad connector it showed 0.5-1V not 3.3. After removing the board and no trackpad connected, its 3.3v. <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR> os 0 ohms as it should be. Any ideas?

On a sidenote, there was a tiny liquid spil on <CAPACITOR>C7555</CAPACITOR> near <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> which after i replaced the IC and made a wire the mac worked again. Customer had issues with trackpad before the mac died. No liquid on cable.trackpad looks very clean.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad
threads.message: Did you try another cable just in case?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad
threads.message: Change <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR>, can be cracked and fails under load only...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad
threads.message: Yes I tried that, another cable. As for <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR>, can we also make a jumper wire cause its 0 ohm?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad
threads.message: Found out the 5V was also missing, related to the <CAPACITOR>C7555</CAPACITOR>, the line to L4820 was broken, so I pulled a wire from L4820 to <CAPACITOR>C7555</CAPACITOR> and working again, thanks for the help guys.
